summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a phone call on January 8, 2020, with an unnamed mother who discusses her limited interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, her daughter's visit to Epstein's home, and her strong belief that Epstein and Maxwell were evil and destroyed her life. The mother indicates she was unaware of what happened to her daughter at the time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The mother advised she did not know him all that well, but he invited her to move to New York with him and Ghislaine Maxwell, and she described him as evil.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The mother advised she did not know her all that well, described her as 'evil, evil as can be' and felt Maxwell was worse than Epstein because she appealed to her as a mother.

connections.description: The mother describes them together as loving art, wanting to help her, lying to her, and being evil individuals who destroyed her life.

events.title: FBI Phone Interview with Mother
events.description: The FBI contacted an unnamed mother by phone to schedule an in-person interview. During the call, she provided information about her daughter's visit to Epstein's home and her views on Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: An unnamed mother and her daughter visited Jeffrey Epstein's home on one occasion.
Epstein and Maxwell invited the mother to move to New York with them, but she declined.
The mother stated she was unaware of what happened to her daughter at the time because she was working.
The mother described Ghislaine Maxwell as 'evil, evil as can be' and felt Maxwell was worse than Epstein because she appealed to her as a mother.
The mother asserted that Epstein and Maxwell destroyed her life.
